region.description: The AWS region that is used as a partition in the Amazon Security Lake instance..
region.caption: Amazon Security Lake - AWS Region

web_resources.description: Details about the resource that is the target of the activity.
web_resources.caption: Web Resources

99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.
status_id.caption: Status ID

severity.description: The event severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.
severity.caption: Severity

metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event.
metadata.caption: Metadata

tls.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) attributes, if available.
tls.caption: TLS

duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.
duration.caption: Duration

category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Application Activity.
category_name.caption: Category

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.
unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data

start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.
start_time.caption: Start Time

end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.
end_time.caption: End Time

observables.description: The observables associated with the event.
observables.caption: Observables

activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.
activity_name.caption: Activity

raw_data.description: The event data as received from the event source.
raw_data.caption: Raw Data

count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.
count.caption: Count

status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.
status.caption: Status

message.description: The description of the event, as defined by the event source.
message.caption: Message

3.description: The incoming request's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements.
3.caption: Access Revoke

99.description: The event activity is not mapped.
99.caption: Other

1.description: The incoming request has permission to the web resource.
1.caption: Access Grant

2.description: The incoming request does not have permission to the web resource.
2.caption: Access Deny

4.description: An error occurred during processing the request.
4.caption: Access Error

activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.
activity_id.caption: Activity ID

status_detail.description: The status details contains additional information about the event outcome.
status_detail.caption: Status Details

src_endpoint.description: Details about the source endpoint of the request.
src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint

status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.
status_code.caption: Status Code

600403.description: The incoming request's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements.
600403.caption: Web Resource Access Activity: Access Revoke

600401.description: The incoming request has permission to the web resource.
600401.caption: Web Resource Access Activity: Access Grant

600402.description: The incoming request does not have permission to the web resource.
600402.caption: Web Resource Access Activity: Access Deny

600404.description: An error occurred during processing the request.
600404.caption: Web Resource Access Activity: Access Error

type_uid.description: The event type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.
type_uid.caption: Type ID

class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Web Resource Access Activity.
class_name.caption: Class

type_name.description: The event type name, as defined by the type_uid.
type_name.caption: Type Name

http_request.description: Details about the underlying HTTP request.
http_request.caption: HTTP Request

proxy.description: Details about the proxy service, if available.
proxy.caption: Proxy

accountid.description: The AWS Account ID that is used as a partition in the Amazon Security Lake instance.
accountid.caption: Amazon Security Lake - AWS Account ID

6.description: Application Activity events report detailed information about the behavior of applications and services.
6.caption: Application Activity

category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.
category_uid.caption: Category ID

enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]
enrichments.caption: Enrichments

6004.description: Web Resource Access Activity events describe successful/failed attempts to access a web resource over HTTP.
6004.caption: Web Resource Access Activity

class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A Class describes the attributes available in an event.
class_uid.caption: Class ID

http_response.description: Details about the HTTP response, if available.
http_response.caption: HTTP Response

3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.
3.caption: Medium

6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.
6.caption: Fatal

99.description: The event severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
99.caption: Other

0.description: The event severity is not known.
0.caption: Unknown

2.description: The user decides if action is needed.
2.caption: Low

5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.
5.caption: Critical

severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.
severity_id.caption: Severity ID

timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.
timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset

name: web_resource_access_activity
description: Web Resource Access Activity events describe successful/failed attempts to access a web resource over HTTP.
caption: Web Resource Access Activity
